events.name: MOBILE SITES CERTIFICATION STUDY JAMS

venue.name: AHMADU BELLO UNIVERSITY ZARIA
venue.address_1: P.M.B. 1044 Samaru. City / Province: Zaria, Kaduna State

events.description:
• What we'll do
Want to sharpen your mobile web skills? Join our study jam to become mobile site certified!

The Mobile Sites certification is a professional accreditation that Google offers to individuals who demonstrate proficiency in basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development. A Mobile Sites certification allows individuals to demonstrate that Google recognizes them as an expert in mobile sites.

This is a chance to get a professional accreditation that demonstrates you have an understanding of basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development. By learning together we think it’s going to be more fun and more of us are going to be able to complete it.

• What to bring
PHONE, PEN, NOTEBOOK, LAPTOP.

• Important to know
• Certificate: Show that you're a certified mobile sites professional with a personalized certificate that you can print!

• Profile page: Share your expertise with a Google Partners public profile page that lists your certifications.

This meetup will explain the benefits of getting certified, how to get certified, and how to share and communicate your certification status with others.

NOTE:
• Duration is estimated to be about 3-4 hours + 90 minute exam

• RSVPING ONLY WILL NOT ADMIT YOU INTO THIS EVENT

• You need to sign up by filling the form here (https://goo.gl/PVytP6)

events.name: Google Assistant - Build Actions for Your Community

venue.name: AHMADU BELLO UNIVERSITY ZARIA
venue.address_1: P.M.B. 1044 Samaru. City / Province: Zaria, Kaduna State

events.description:
Venue: Faculty of Pharmaceutical Science

Learn more about the "Build Actions for Your Community" initiative here:
https://youtu.be/ShvipgvoOAY

This is the first in a 2-part series of events focused on Conversational UI/UX in general, and on building apps for the Google Assistant in particular. The date/venue for part B will be updated here prior to the event. However, here is the expected agenda:

=====================
PART A: Morning
======================
10:00 am
Welcome / Doors Open
10:10 am
Building Conversational Experiences / What's New In Google Assistant?
Get an overview of Google Assistant, DialogFlow and related tools, technologies & best practices.
10:40 am
Conversational Design
Developing for Google Assistant
We'll walk through the process for designing and building a Google Assistant application. Attendees are encouraged to bring laptops to code-along or explore related code-labs during this segment.
11:10 am
Coffee Break
11:25 am
Codelab: Facts about you / Bitcoin Info
12:05 pm
Lunch

===========================
PART B: Afternoon
===========================
13:00 pm
Creating your own Actions for the Google Assistant
15:30 pm
Feedback on the Actions on Google Platform
Design Bootcamp / Learn to design a conversational UI/UX
16:10 pm
Demo your Actions
Developer Bootcamp / Learn to use DialogFlow for building/testing a simple app
16:50 pm
Wrap Up
Mini-Hack begins....
17:00 pm
Prizes & Raffle
Goodbye / Networking

Come along with your laptops and Smartphones.
Talks (supported by Google-authored content)
Codelabs & Hacking (supported by Google-authored content)
Technicals
Actions showcasing on event and on Google site
Webinars.

For enquiries contact:
NAFIU GARBA [masked]
SUFFIAH SALEH [masked]

Our URLS:
https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Zaria
https://www.plus.google.com/gdgzaria
https://www.facebook.com/gdgzaria
https://www.twitter.com/gdgzaria

events.description:
What we'll do:
TensorFlow Dev Summit brings together a diverse mix of machine learning users from around the world for a full day of highly technical talks, demos, and conversation with the TensorFlow team and community. In TensorFlow Dev Summit EXTENDED we will watch together the recorded TensorFlow summit.

We will include a Machine Learning Crash Course for those who wish to learn about Machine Learning from a practical, applied perspective that will enable them to use machine learning within their every day projects, and who wish to benefit from the power.

Event Agenda:
9:00 Icebreakers game to get people know each other

10:15 am Streaming live video of the conference + time for discussion

MACHINE LEARNING STUDENT JAM

11:15 pm Event start

11:30 pm Overview & first 3 modules of MLCC

1:15 pm COFFEE BREAK TIME

1:30 pm TensorFlow modules

3:15 pm Entertainment/Coding Contest

4:00 pm Photo sessions

What to bring:
Bring your laptop! It's essential!
High spirits!

Important to know:
Seats are limited!

events.name: I/O Extended 2018 Zaria

venue.name: AHMADU BELLO UNIVERSITY ZARIA
venue.address_1: P.M.B. 1044 Samaru. City / Province: Zaria, Kaduna State

events.description:
Google I/O is Google's yearly Developer Conference -and at Google I/O 2018 (https://events.google.com/io/) we are expected to learn about new and interesting things from Google, interesting for us developers, IT geeks and techies.

A Google I/O extended (https://events.google.com/io/extended/) event is an extension of the event, a great opportunity to get together, chat, listen to the keynotes, discuss further. Google I/O Extended are taking place across the globe, at the same time or around the time of Google I/O.

Of course we from GDG Zaria - #GDGZaria - do the same!

Come and join us for our Google I/O extended on the first day of Google I/O, May 12 (the whole conference runs May 8-10, but the I/O Extended event is limited to one evening 12 May).

This year we are again at Trivago #trivago, who has offered to sponsor with location - thank you for that!

ATTENTION: Only when you are listed in meetup as "attending", you are able to enter the event. This is because of security reasons. So if you bring friends, be sure he accepted via meetup.

Just like before we have a bunch of other activities planned so come and join us, learn more about GDG Zaria, talk tech, and learn what news Google wants us to hear for 2018.

Space is limited, so make sure you sign up!

KEYNOTES starts at 9:00a.m sharp - we will watch the live stream from Google I/O in Mountain View.

BRING your laptop, we'll be going through some code labs and there will be time for questions (of course you can come just for the networking and I/O keynotes as well, if you don't feel like bringing the laptop.)

After the Keynotes there will be time to mingle, discuss what was presented in the keynotes from Google, and much more - of course we'll have both food and drinks.

Speakers Include:
Professor Sahalu Junaid (ABU Zaria)
Mr. Auwal Gene (ABU Zaria)
Engr. Yusuf Bashir (Kad ICT Hub)
Aminu Ibrahim (Lead GCDC)
Aminu Bakori (Payant Ng)
Zulfatu Farouq (Oriflame)
Sanusi Lawal (Hive Talents)
Abdulaziz Ladan (3D Art Academy)
Ibrahim Zero (Zerosoft Compnay Ltd)

Others will be updated soon ...

Remember to keep your RSVP up to date - cancel your attendance if you cannot make it, so someone else can join instead.

NOTICE! We are still planning for and preparing this event so information might be updated. Stay tuned!

A SEPARATE event, with limited space will start earlier in 2 days earlier, for those who happen to be free and want to start early with code labs. Stay tuned and keep an eye on Meetup to find out more! The smaller group joins the rest when the bigger event starts.

events.name: Flutter Study Jam

venue.name: AHMADU BELLO UNIVERSITY ZARIA
venue.address_1: P.M.B. 1044 Samaru. City / Province: Zaria, Kaduna State

events.description:
Flutter Study Jams are Community-run study groups based on the Flutter Udacity Course. Participants learn how to use Flutter to develop high-quality, interactive mobile applications for iOS and Android devices. Study Jams are a great opportunity to bring members of your community together to learn Flutter in person and support them to complete the course.

Everyone, who completes the course will get a Google-offered Study Jam completion certificate and a profile badge.
Flutter Study Jam is suited best for:
1) those just getting started with mobile app development
2) those with programming experience on other mobile app frameworks.

Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

Join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter Udacity Course prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals..

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out : https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

Agenda:
9:00pm: Flutter Udacity Course Introduction
9:30pm: Udacity Course Lesson 1
11:00pm: Break
11:30pm: Udacity Course Lesson 1 continue
1:00pm: Event ends

events.name: Women Techmakers Lightning Talks
events.description:
For our July meetup, Women Techmakers Zaria is hosting an event that promotes women speakers. We will get together and hear from the talented women of the Zaria and Neighbouring tech community.

If you are interested in giving a 10 to 15 minute talk at this meetup, please fill out this form (https://goo.gl/cdxD7j).

10:00AM Networking & Pizza

10:30PM Announcements

10:45PM Talks

• Why Natural Language Processing Needs Sociolinguistics.
• What's new in NIST Digital Identity Guidelines.

• Hacking Gradle to Deliver 120 APKs.

• Get Started with Machine Learning, Suffiah Saleh, WTM Zaria organizer & Women Techmakers Lead

We have a really interesting line up of topics, including:

• Fun with Johnny-Five

• Opening the Vault: Discussion on IT Security, Politics and Civil Rights

• Read Between the Code: A Day in the Life of an IT Project Manager

• Android JSON Calls with Puppets

• Static Website with Github Pages

Please note that this meetup happens in the main Google building. This means we need to provide building security with first/last names of attendees.

If you RSVP for this event with an incomplete name or alias, you will be moved to the wait list until that is corrected

While all the speakers will be women, everyone is invited to attend. Join us!

events.name: NORTH-WEST MAKEATHON

venue.name: Kad ICT Hub
venue.address_1: 47 Kanta Road, off independence way, kaduna State. Nigeria

events.description:
Register a team of 2-3 and winners will have the opportunity of incubation - acceleration and $1000 USD grand prize.

The NWMakeathon is an open and intensive solution creation contest which would cut across the region with the objective of bringing together the skills and knowledge of a diverse set of individuals and institutions including entrepreneurs, start-ups, innovators, businesses, academics, policymakers, and community leaders, all committed to address the socio-economic challenges of North-West Nigeria.

events.name: CLOUD STUDY JAM SERIES - 1.0 (2019)
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where
to begin?
Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through
three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get
free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs
at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile.

Please make sure to bring your laptops and chargers since this will be a totally hands-on event.

events.name: Google Analytics for Business
events.description:
Do you know that what gets measured, gets managed best?
-> Learn how to create an account, implement tracking code, and set up data filters.
-> You'll learn how to navigate the Google Analytics interface and reports, and set up dashboards and shortcuts.
-> Hands-on on how to analyze basic Audience, Acquisition, and Behavior reports, and set up goals and campaign tracking.
-> Learn how to generate custom analytics report for your business and know your customers better
-> and much more...
